pullRequest.title: initial Cognos OMAS implementation
pullRequest.bodyText:
This is initial implementation of the Analytics Modeling OMAS plugin.

User documentation *.md files will be added separately.
Event listener is left for further event processing.

The plugin is based on plugin information-view https://github.com/odpi/egeria/blob/master/open-metadata-implementation/access-services/information-view/README.md

commit.message:
initial Cognos OMAS implementation

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: Not sure this is a test framework we use - be interesting to hear more about it

nodes.bodyText:
Needs to implement ExceptionMessageSet and include HTTP erro codes.
The descriptions need to provide enough information for the external user of your service to fix the problem - for example what for you need to verify in the topic event?
This is all deprecated

+/* SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 */

+package org.odpi.openmetadata.accessservices.cognos.ffdc;

+
+public enum CognosErrorCode {
+
+	ADD_RELATIONSHIP_EXCEPTION(
+			"OMAS-COGNOS-005", 
+			"Relationship {0} could not be added. Error: {1}",
+			"The system is unable to process the request.", 
+			"Verify the topic event."),
+	GET_ENTITY_EXCEPTION(
+			"OMAS-COGNOS-006", 
+			"Entity matching criteria [{0}={1}] could not be fetched. Error: {2}",

+	GET_RELATIONSHIP_EXCEPTION(

nodes.bodyText: Do not pass the code to the exception because it prevents codes from external components from being passed.
Typically avoid runtime exceptions except for logic errors
Javadoc?
Are these rest API response object - don't then need Jackson annotations?

nodes.bodyText: Need to work on these messages - should be explaining what the service does and what to look out for in the start up
There are handlers in the common services that do this - better to use them rather than creating own implementation.
Need to pass the server userId or end user's id - not a fixed value.
Extend the base class rather than implement the interface
Asset or Database handler?
Need to handle runtime exceptions and get them to the audit log - no exception class should leave the server because it has a stack trace in it.
Should be using the platform services - not having your own map since your service will not be listed in the platform API query of the server's active services

+package org.odpi.openmetadata.accessservices.cognos.server.spring;
+
+import io.swagger.v3.oas.annotations.ExternalDocumentation;
+import io.swagger.v3.oas.annotations.tags.Tag;
+import org.odpi.openmetadata.accessservices.cognos.responses.CognosOMASAPIResponse;
+import org.odpi.openmetadata.accessservices.cognos.server.CognosRestServices;
+import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping;
+import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PathVariable;
+import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.PostMapping;
+import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestBody;
+import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping;
+import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestParam;
+import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController;
+
+
+
+@RestController
+@RequestMapping("/servers/{serverName}/open-metadata/access-services/cognos/users/{userId}/")
+
+@Tag(name="Cognos OMAS",
+	description="The Cognos OMAS queries RDBMS metadata and creates modules for IBM Cognos Analytics.",
+	externalDocs=@ExternalDocumentation(description="Cognos Open Metadata Access Service (OMAS)",
+	url="https://egeria.odpi.org/open-metadata-implementation/access-services/cognos/"))
+
+
+public class CognosOMASResource {
+
+    private final CognosRestServices restAPI = new CognosRestServices();
+
+	/**
+	 * Get list of databases.

+     * @param userId      the unique identifier for the user
+	 * @return Cognos response contains list of databases.
+	 */
+	@GetMapping(path = "/databases")
+	public CognosOMASAPIResponse getDatabases(
+			@PathVariable("serverName") String serverName,
+            @PathVariable("userId") String userId

+	{
+		return restAPI.getDatabases(serverName);
+	}
+
+	/**
+	 * Get list of schemas of a given dataSource.
+     * @param serverName  unique identifier for requested server.
+     * @param userId      the unique identifier for the user
+	 * @param dataSource data source GUID.
+	 * @return Cognos response contains list of database schemas.
+	 */
+	@GetMapping(path = "/{dataSourceGUID}/schemas")
+	public CognosOMASAPIResponse getSchemas(
+			@PathVariable("serverName") String serverName,
+            @PathVariable("userId") String userId,

nodes.bodyText: Need a specialized response object for each type of response - otherwise can not see what is returned.

commit.message:
fix junit tests for OS independent EOL

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: Write audit log record of type "EVENT"
Not interested in new entities? Or reclassified entities that could indicate that an asset has moved into a supported zone?

Typically APIs support 3 checked exceptions - InvalidParameterException, UserNotAuthorizedException and PropertyServerException.  This enables the caller to work out if it is a coding error, set up error (ie user not set up correctly) or a deeper issue in the metadata ecosystem.
Should not be wrapping checked exceptions in a runtime exception - need to let them flow to client.

Use repository handler because it has error handling in it.
If the GUID is not valid, the result is EntityNotKnownException.  This is being mapped to a get entity exception and the null reponse is being mapped to an entity not found error code - I think this might be confusing to debug.

What if there are 4000 databases to return - need paging.
This is a general comment - all of the APIs that retrieve a list need paging parameters.
In addition the userId need to be passed so it can be used on the call to the repository connector - otherwise the repositroy connector will throw an exception if the user is not correct when security is turned on.

Need to validate that GUID is not null - in fact this is a general comment that parameters coming from the API need to be policed both client side and server side.  The server side parameter validation is typically done in the handler layer.

This is an expensive way to get the method name - typically we set up a static final string in the REST services layer and pass it down - it means that the method name in externalised messages and exceptions is a method name that is meaningful to the consumer.
For logic/unexpected errors the stack trace is logged to the audit log in an EXCEPTION message.
For checked exceptions, the error handling values should have enough information to debug the problem without the stack trace.

Debug logging should not be used for error handling.  This logging will be turned off in a production environment.
We also avoid using variable names of a single letter because it makes it harder for someone else to read.

Need to filter returned assets to removed those not in the supported zones.
(This is done for you if you use the relationalDatabaseHandler - or if you don't like that, the more primitive asset handler)

I think Mandy mentioned this, but the intent would be to have more generalization with the intent (albeit difficult on a sample of 1) to support different tools in the same class - so I wouldn't expect the omas to be cognos specific

nodes.bodyText:
A -server component should not be dependent on any spring components.
We like to isolate these to our -spring components -- which are used in the server chassis & UI only - in part this is to make it easier for consumers to utilize their own rest api frameworks - and indeed to consider this for egeria itself in future

+            <groupId>org.springframework</groupId>
+            <artifactId>spring-core</artifactId>

nodes.bodyText: we keep all versions in the dependencyManagement section of the top level pom - so the idea is you template the dependency there, and then in each sub-module pom do not include version, just group/artifact

nodes.bodyText:
We will presumably get INFO messages in the build - just need to ensure these are kept manageable and don't log any text with ERROR or WARNING to aid in parsing the results.
Further -- note that for the chassis by default all output should be through the audit logging framework - we have logging disabled by default

+
+<configuration>
+
+    <appender name="STDOUT" class="ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender">
+        <!-- encoders are assigned the type
+             ch.qos.logback.classic.encoder.PatternLayoutEncoder by default -->
+        <encoder>
+            <pattern>%d{HH:mm:ss.SSS} [%thread] %-5level %logger{36} - %msg%n</pattern>
+        </encoder>
+    </appender>
+    <logger name="org.odpi.openmetadata.accessservices.cognos" level="INFO" />

commit.message:
fix error handling:
1. Runtime exceptions are replaced with checked
2. CognosErrorCode implements ExceptionMessageSet


Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

switched to junit4 from junit5

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

clean pom files:
1. add scm element
2. replace local version dependency with the version from
dependencyManagement

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

dependency on spring-core removed for server module

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

Simplified Response container,
Event listener removed, will be added as part event implementation


Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

move tests to testNG framework since junit4 tests are skipped

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

Audit code enum implements AuditLogMessageSet

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

use superclass implementations for Admin

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

set context for logging from constant

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

fix ambiguous Module reference for java 11.

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

add Javadocs

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

fix Model class reference ambiguity.

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

use OCF base classes for Cognos OMAS Service instance, instance handler

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

use OMRSRepositoryPropertiesUtilities to create  property values
move testing code

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

logging REST calls
remove slf4j logging
handle exceptions with standard handler at API level

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

rename Cognos to AnalyticsModeling: classes renaming

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

rename Cognos to AnalyticsModeling: packages renaming

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

rename Cognos to AnalyticsModeling: remove references of Cognos from
source code

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

rename Cognos to AnalyticsModeling: AccessServiceDescription and
references

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

rename plugin for parent project

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

fix Java 11 class ambiguity

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

fix attribute name in the module response

fix typo

Signed-off-by: Yevgeniy Marchenko <yevgeniy.marchenko@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: This audit log entry is an INFO not DEBUG - this means it should not be putput one each requests.  Either use SLF4J or turn the Category to be DEBUG
These message descriptions will not pass the audit log unit test.  It is ok for an initial drop but needs to be improved - look at unit test for the Audit log and exceptions in Asset Owner OMAS
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,120 @@ +/* SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 */ +/* Copyright Contributors to the ODPi Egeria project. */ +package org.odpi.openmetadata.accessservices.analyticsmodeling.auditlog; + + +import org.odpi.openmetadata.frameworks.auditlog.messagesets.AuditLogMessageDefinition; +import org.odpi.openmetadata.frameworks.auditlog.messagesets.AuditLogMessageSet; +import org.odpi.openmetadata.frameworks.auditlog.messagesets.MessageDefinition; +import org.odpi.openmetadata.repositoryservices.auditlog.OMRSAuditLogRecordSeverity; + +/** + * The AnalyticsModelingAuditCode is used to define the message content for the OMRS Audit Log. + *

+ * The 5 fields in the enum are: + *

    + *
  • Log Message Id - to uniquely identify the message
    • + *
  • Severity - is this an event, decision, action, error or exception
    • + *
  • Log Message Text - includes placeholder to allow additional values to be captured
    • + *
  • Additional Information - further parameters and data relating to the audit message (optional)
    • + *
  • SystemAction - describes the result of the situation
    • + *
  • UserAction - describes how a user should correct the situation
    • + *
+ */ +public enum AnalyticsModelingAuditCode implements AuditLogMessageSet { + + SERVICE_INITIALIZING("OMAS-ANALYTICS-MODELING-0001", + OMRSAuditLogRecordSeverity.STARTUP,

nodes.bodyText: This error handling is merging errors due to bad parameters, security errors and errors in the repositorys into a single exception.  This makes it hard for the client to recover.  See https://egeria.odpi.org/open-metadata-publication/website/diagnostic-guide/
I can not see 1) where the security verifier is called to check the user has access to the asset - or the supportedZones are checked.
